results.title: Aileen Wuornos: the selling of a serial killer
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Broomfield, Rieta Oord and Lafayette Films
results.brief_description: Dubbed “America’s first female serial killer”, prostitute Aileen Wuornos killed seven men between 1990-91. While she claims self-defence and then is later persuaded by her “supporters” to change her plea, Broomfield skillfully reveals the layers of truth that surround the case. By implication, Broomfield disarmingly and ironically identifies himself as one of those attempting to gain from the “Wuornos Industry”.

results.title: Aids: what everyone needs to know [Revised] (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An authoritative exploration of AIDS produced in cooperation with the UCLA AIDS Centre. Discusses symptoms, transmission, diagnosis, how the body becomes prone to other diseases and the increasing danger to the general population. A family in which the husband has AIDS share their feelings.

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Intermediate
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia and University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department
results.brief_description: The 30 minute Intermediate program has a more rigorous pace, and the exercises used are more demanding with fewer repetitions. The tape requires a good basic level of fitness, and assumes a level of flexibility and co-ordination such as would be developed through a consistent use of the Beginners Program. For many exercisers, and for elderly exercisers in particular, the intermediate program may be as far as they wish to go. Rated: G

results.title: Aids: not adults only
results.creator_credit: Cristina Pozzan, Ray Argall and Musical Films
results.brief_description: Four teenagers explore issues surrounding AIDS in frank and informative interviews with counsellors, other teenagers and a 19 year old who contracted the virus. Discusses how AIDS affects the current generation and challenges common misconceptions about the disease. The theme is prevention while simultaneously providing an opportunity for adolescents to review their attitudes and behaviour.

results.title: Adieu Bonaparte = Al-Wedaa Ya Bonaparte
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine, Humbert Balsan, Marianne Khoury and Jean-Pierre Mahot
results.brief_description:
The experiences of an Egyptian family during the occupation of Alexandria by Napoleon and his army, and the uneasy friendship between a young Egyptian poet and one of Bonaparte’s advisers.

Credits: Producer, Jean-Pierre Mahot, Marianne Khoury, Humbert Balsan ; director, Youssef Chahine ; writers, Youssef Chahine, Jean-Michel Comet, Mohsen Mohiedine, Youry Nasrallah ; photography, Moshen Nasr ; music, Gabriel Yared.
Cast: Michel Piccoli, Patrice Chereau, Moshen Mohiedine, Moshena Tewfik.

results.title: AIDS
results.creator_credit: Joanne Parrent and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: A broad approach that deals with the nature of AIDS, the means of infection, symptoms, prevention, advice and personal responsibilities in relationships. The comprehensive information involves no sexually explicit material and as such is particularly suitable as an introduction to the topic.

results.title: Aids
results.creator_credit: George Pugh and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A 4-Corners presentation examining the history of the AIDS epidemic in the United States and the spread to gay communities in the Western World including Australia. Medical authorities discuss their hopes to contain the spread of AIDS outlining symptoms and debunking myths regarding transmission of the virus. A series of frank interviews highlight the human cost of AIDS. Due to copyright restrictions, certain parts of the music soundtrack have been edited resulting in sound drop-out in sections of the program.

results.title: Addio tradizione
results.creator_credit: Anna Louise Sortini, South Australian Film Corporation and Open Window Productions
results.brief_description: Childhood memories are recalled whilst Sylvanna (Marcella Russo), a housewife, ponders her adolescent years with migrant Italian parents in Australia. A series of moving images show the Italian customs experienced throughout her childhood and the growing tensions and difficulties in the family as she reaches puberty and the two cultures of differing family values clash.

results.title: Aida
results.creator_credit: Pierre Jourdan, Daniele Gegauff and Stephane Tchalgadjieff
results.brief_description:
This version of Verdi’s ‘Aida’ was recorded at the antique theatre of Orange (France). The stage direction is by Sandro Segui, decors by Pier-Luigi Pizi and choreography by Jacques Garnier. The Orchestra ‘Lirico di Torino’ is conducted by Thomas Schippers.

Credits: Cast: Producers, Stephane Tchalgadjieff, Daniele Gegauff ; director, Pierre Jourdan ; photography, Jean-Pierre Lazar.
Cast: Gilda Cruz-Romo, Grace Bumbry, Peter Gougalov.
